intro: Festuca media, commonly known as bluegrass, is a cool-season grass native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its fine, dark green blades and dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soils. It is often used in lawns and as a ground cover due to its durability and aesthetic appeal. Festuca media is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
